question: A 54 Old man diabetic hypeensive was brought to NIMHANS OPD with history of loss of sensation on left side of upper body, loss of facial sensation on right side. O/E there was constricted pupil, paial ptosis, anhydrosis , gait ataxia nystagmus was present on right side. which is the common aery involvement can lead to this condition?
exp: MR-Angiography of the neck (carotid and veebral aeries):1,Brachiocephalic trunk (or innominate aery).2,Right subclan aery.3,Right veebral aery.4,Right common carotid aery.5,Right internal carotid aery.6,Left veebral aery.7,Left internal carotid aery.8,Left external carotid aery.9,Left common carotid aery.10,Left subclan aery.11,Aoa. Condition above described is characteristic of WALLENBERG SYNDROME which occur due to involvement of intracranial segment of veebral aery.

question: Fluorescin angiography is used to examine-
exp: Fluorescin angiography used to examine: Retinal vasculature in DM retinopathy patients for neovascularization. Normal retinal vasculature on flouroscein angiography.

question: Four vessel carotid angiography done by injecting dye into-
exp: Four vessel carotid angiography is usually done by injecting dye into: Femoral aery

question: IOC for Acute Aoic Dissection in a Clinically Unstable patient is?
exp: *In Acute Aoic Dissection Stable Patient-CT-Angio (MDCT with contrast) Unstable Patient-TransEsophageal Echo(TEE)

question: Most Definitive test for evaluating Intracranial aneurysms is?
exp: *Cerebral Angiography is the Gold standard for the detection of intracranial Aneurysms

question: Feeding Aery and a well defined nidus is characteristic of?
exp: Feeding Aery and Nidus is seen in True AV malformation Popcorn Appearance in Cavernous Angioma Medusa Head /Spoke wheel pattern in Venous Angioma

question: A 26 years old man came with complaints of pain in abdomen with few episodes of haematuria. On examination, patient's BP is 160/100 mm of Hg. Patient is refractory to standard antihypeensive drugs. On renal Doppler, parvus tardus pattern was seen. Subsequently, CT renal angiogram was done. This condition as shown below may occur in all of the following except?
exp: Among the option provided, renal aery stenosis is least likely to be seen in PAN. Causes of renal aery stenosis- Atherosclerosis, FMD, takayasu aeritis, non-specific aoo-aeritis, APLA, renal aery embolism.

question: Gold Standard investigation for pulmonary Thromboembolism?
exp: *Gold standard is Pulmonary Angiography. *IOC - CT Angio. CE pulmonary angiogram showing hypodense thrombus in left main pulmonary aery.

question: 25 year old male met with an accident and is brought to emergency depament with symptoms of headache and paralysis. CT scan shows sub arachnoid haemorrhage. What is the next investigation of choice?
exp: Next IOC in pt. presenting with SAH is 4-Vessel angiograph. To know the cause of SAH IOC - 4-Vessel angiography 2 Veebral aeries & 2 internal carotid ateries. IOC for acute SAH (<48 hrs) - NCCT IOC for chronic SAH (>48 hrs)-MRI
